newsitem.title: INDIA: Israel says ready to discuss India free trade pact.
newsitem.headline: Israel says ready to discuss India free trade pact.

text.p: Israel is ready to discuss a free trade agreement with India to boost their business ties, a visiting Israeli foreign ministry offical said in New Delhi on Tuesday.

"We are ready to negotiate a free trade agreement with India on the same level of pacts we have with the United States, Canada and the European Union," said Itzhak Shelef, the Israeli foreign ministry's deputy director general, Asia and Pacific.
Shelef told reporters that trade between the two countries had increased steadily after they established diplomatic ties in 1992.
Bilateral trade between India and Israel stood at $600 million in 1995, with Israel's export share at $350 million, an Israeli diplomat said.
